title: Large-Scale Self-Regulated Learning Strategy Workshop for Practitioners: VR-Based Reflective Practice and Civic Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic organizational work experience and learning management tool proficiency, with elementary understanding of social institutions and organizational culture
context.additional_context: Practically applying self-regulated learning strategies through simulations of complex work environments faced by professionals and VR-based scenario training. Emphasizes communication skills in multicultural organizational settings and civic engagement capabilities. Explores modern organizational problem-solving approaches through historical case analysis

learning_goals: Learners will apply the self-regulated learning model (planning-execution-evaluation-reflection) to real work scenarios with 80% or higher accuracy, enhancing collaborative problem-solving skills as organizational citizens.

Learners will achieve a score of 3 or higher on a 4-point rubric for metacognitive strategy-based decision-making when selecting learning strategies in a VR simulation environment, and develop strategies considering institutional contexts within complex work relationships.

Learners will consistently demonstrate the ability to analyze weekly learning outcomes and establish improvement plans through reflective journaling in three consecutive evaluations, fostering professional rights awareness and social responsibility.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
